name: Chucky Men­doza and the Curse of the Pharaoh
name_original: Chucky Men­doza and the Curse of the Pharaoh
description:
Chucky Men­doza and the Curse of the Pharaoh is very lovely and charm­ing old school plat­former game inspired by 80's 8-Bit retro games on clas­sic com­put­ers like the C64. Run across screen, jump over obsta­cles, col­lect trea­sures through­out a cursed pyra­mid, avoid trip­mines, lava pits and var­i­ous deadly ene­mies (includ­ing bats, mum­mies, bugs, cobras) along the way.

For peo­ple who remem­ber the AMIGA game »Rick Dan­ger­ous«, this game was def­i­nitely no inspi­ra­tion. I hated »Rick Dan­ger­ous«! It's more a trib­ute to C64 games like Spe­lunker, H.E.R.O., Pit­fall II and Pharaoh's Curse.

FEA­TURES

Really retro gam­ing:
– no save points
– no tuto­r­ial
– no extras
– only three lives
– no damn time limit
– no achieve­ment (beside win­ning the game)
– no multiplayer

and — damn — only one dif­fi­culty: »retro hard«
So make the best out of it and play like gamer played in 1983!

CRED­ITS

Graph­ics, code, sound & ambi­ent music by {ths}
Title music by Cur­tithird
Sound effects made with Bfxr
Coded with Sten­cyl
